context: The word 'ela' is a verb form in Estonian. It appears to be an imperative or connegative form of the verb 'elama' (to live/to exist). As shown in the Wiktionary entry, it can function as: 1) present active indicative connegative second-person singular, 2) present imperative second-person singular, and 3) present imperative connegative second-person singular. It's commonly used to mean 'live!' or in expressions like 'elad veel?' (do you still live/are you still alive?).
